commit_message:
Correct docs on format for nova::policy data

Correct the format of the $policies parameter to nova::policy.
That parameter is passed directly to create_resources, so it needs
to be in a format acceptable to that.

Just updating docs here as anyone already using the policy classes
are likely not using the (incorrectly) documented format, anyway.

Change-Id: I774678f0b49ee05b6aee6a5565302377d8eae186
Closes-bug: 1409897
(cherry picked from commit 96b96f33939862543e62695b1dff14b80d893c33)

commit_message:
Correct docs on format for neutron::policy data

Correct the format of the $policies parameter to neutron::policy.
That parameter is passed directly to create_resources, so it needs
to be in a format acceptable to that.

Just updating docs here as anyone already using the policy classes
are likely not using the (incorrectly) documented format, anyway.

Change-Id: Ib69e2e421b216d6087ad47c198067667db89cc33
Closes-bug: 1409897
(cherry picked from commit 6d2aa10d8f8ed2dc05ee300e067e431d02d2209e)

commit_message:
Correct docs on format for glance::policy data

Correct the format of the $policies parameter to glance::policy.
That parameter is passed directly to create_resources, so it needs
to be in a format acceptable to that.

Just updating docs here as anyone already using the policy classes
are likely not using the (incorrectly) documented format, anyway.

Change-Id: I80f1f832db124eef3bfd75907e4a2dcb5a5effca
Closes-bug: 1409897
(cherry picked from commit ad5bb3d76b98b847bac5ed2467a46173343a1264)

the correct user name and password (or "secret") combination.

Change-Id: I2c4c8320c7471e5cf2e2e242dbe1729c8974bf28
Implements: blueprint add-chap-authentication-support-to-cloudbyte-cinder-driver
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-04-16 11:54:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Add chap support to CloudByte cinder driver

CloudByte iSCSI cinder driver currently does not support
iSCSI CHAP security setting. This opens a security vulnerability
whereby any host machine can mount a CloudByte iSCSI volumes
created via OpenStack.

The solution is to have two configurable parameters i.e. 'cb_use_chap'
and 'cb_auth_group' in cinder configuration file and based on these
parameters the CloudByte driver will set the CHAP secret as part of
volume attach request. This will ensure secure access to CloudByte
iSCSI volumes.

Bit about new parameters:

cb_use_chap :   Used to enable or disable CHAP security while creating
                CloudByte iSCSI volumes.
	        Set 'cb_use_chap = True' to enable or 'cb_use_chap = False'
	        to disable the CHAP security.

cb_auth_group : This corresponds to the discovery authentication group in
                CloudByte storage. Chap users are added to this group.                          Drive uses the first user found for this group.

                If 'cb_use_chap = True' then admin has to manually add
		the auth group and chap username/password in CloudByte
		storage and assign auth group name to 'cb_auth_group'
		or None.

Change-Id: I2c4c8320c7471e5cf2e2e242dbe1729c8974bf28
Implements: blueprint add-chap-authentication-support-to-cloudbyte-cinder-driver

commit_message:
Add chap support to CloudByte cinder driver

CloudByte iSCSI cinder driver currently does not support
iSCSI CHAP security setting. This opens a security vulnerability
whereby any host machine can mount a CloudByte iSCSI volumes
created via OpenStack.

This patch adds CHAP authentication support for the CloudByte iSCSI
cinder driver.

Admin has to manually add the auth group and chap username/password in
CloudByte storage. Driver uses the first user found in auth group.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I2c4c8320c7471e5cf2e2e242dbe1729c8974bf28
Implements: blueprint add-chap-authentication-support-to-cloudbyte-cinder-driver

commit_message:
Skip python34 job for doc-only nova changes

This change skips nova-python34 job for doc-only nova changes
(other non-doc jobs[1] are already skipped).

commit_message:
Switch on requirements check for nova-docker

docker-py is now in global-requirements. So we should
get the proposal jobs to submit reviews to nova-docker.

Change-Id: I4b56fd02cdf3b4a4a503707731a195396aef47d5

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-01 00:50:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Don't delete port from bridge on delete_port event

Commit d6a55c17360d1aa8ca91849199987ae71e8600ee added
logic to the OVS agent to delete a port from the integration
bridge when a port was deleted on the Neutron side. However,
this led to several races where whoever created the initial
port (e.g. Nova, L3 agent, DHCP agent) would be trying to
remove the port from the bridge at the same time. These
would result in ugly exceptions on one side or the other.

The original commit was trying to address the problem where
the port would maintain connectivity even though it was removed
from the integration bridge.

This patch addresses both cases by removing the iptables rules
for the deleted port and putting it in the dead VLAN so it loses
connectivity. However, it still leaves the port attached to the
integration bridge so the original creator can delete it.

Related-Bug: #1333365
Closes-Bug: #1448148
Change-Id: I7ae7750b7ac7d15325ed9f2d517ca171543b53be

commit_message:
Don't delete port from bridge on delete_port event

Commit d6a55c17360d1aa8ca91849199987ae71e8600ee added
logic to the OVS agent to delete a port from the integration
bridge when a port was deleted on the Neutron side. However,
this led to several races where whoever created the initial
port (e.g. Nova, L3 agent, DHCP agent) would be trying to
remove the port from the bridge at the same time. These
would result in ugly exceptions on one side or the other.

The original commit was trying to address the problem where
the port would maintain connectivity even though it was removed
from the integration bridge.

This patch addresses both cases by removing the iptables rules
for the deleted port and putting it in the dead VLAN so it loses
connectivity. However, it still leaves the port attached to the
integration bridge so the original creator can delete it.

Related-Bug: #1333365
Closes-Bug: #1448148
Change-Id: I7ae7750b7ac7d15325ed9f2d517ca171543b53be

subject: Make crux compatible with delorean packaging
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-02 03:19:15.000000000', 'files': ['docker/centos/binary/centos-binary-base/Dockerfile', 'docker/centos/binary/fedora-binary-base/Dockerfile'], 'message': 'Make crux compatible with delorean packaging

The previous version of crus 6-1 installed pbr hooks.  This is
incompatible with CentOS RDO.  Remove the requirements.txt file
from the RPM that is installed.  This required placing the files
in a new COPRS repository.  Since Lars no longer contributes to
Kolla, I imported his src rpm, made the necessary adjustments,
and created a new COPRS repo for it.

The result of the PBR hooks is that any container that ran crux
would fail with a distribution error about argparse not being
present when it was present.

Change-Id: Ibdbccd9e0dd5aeb6d6292bd633b9d2dde8c7b4ce
Closes-bug: #1460886
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Make crux compatible with delorean packaging

The previous version of crus 6-1 installed pbr hooks.  This is
incompatible with CentOS RDO.  Remove the requirements.txt file
from the RPM that is installed.  This required placing the files
in a new COPRS repository.  Since Lars no longer contributes to
Kolla, I imported his src rpm, made the necessary adjustments,
and created a new COPRS repo for it.

The result of the PBR hooks is that any container that ran crux
would fail with a distribution error about argparse not being
present when it was present.

Change-Id: Ibdbccd9e0dd5aeb6d6292bd633b9d2dde8c7b4ce
Closes-bug: #1460886

commit_message:
Rework shell tests

This is the first step in reworking the shell argument handling,
clean up and add tests to ensure functionality doesn't change.

* Rework shell tests to break down global options and auth options.
* Make tests table-driven
* Remove 'os_' from 'cacert' and 'default_domain' internal option names

Change-Id: Icf69c7e84f3f44b366fe64b6bbf4e3fe958eb302

commit_message:
Show the right request body in v2 port update api.

Divide the file port_create_or_update_req.json/xml into 2 different
sample files, named port_create_req.json/xml and port_update_req.json/xml.
And give the related reponse for them.

Change-Id: I8a586d8e5eaeef9ed8294dc50be27939410d88e4
Closes-bug:#1460500

commit_message:
Delete App image from swift

Delete DU docker image file from swift when an app is deleted.

This feature requires a reference from the assembly table to the
image table, which was missing. I've added it in this patch.

Change-Id: I1017665a7c936c5a7144c8cb1e5486a606d7bbb7
Closes-bug: 1459766

commit_message:
Delete LP image files from swift

The LP delete method does not delete the docker image
file from swift.

This results in orphaned image files being left in the users
swift account. The user gets charged for storage and it can be
hard to identify these image files for manual deletion by the
user.

This patch deletes the these image files from swift, when the
user deletes an LP using the CLI.

Change-Id: I90fd7f51b26fd580ac3ee68c243a33ebb6671aaf
Closes-bug: 1459766

commit_message:
Delete APP logs from swift

The APP delete method does not delete logs.

This results in orphaned log files being left in the users swift
account. The user gets charged for storage and it can be hard to
identify these log files for manual deletion by the user.

This patch deletes the log files from swift or local filesystem
(depending upon the config setting).

Change-Id: Ia733d6e96286ca7048376c99179aae66d420c4b8
Closes-bug: 1457682

commit_message:
Delete LP logs from swift

The LP delete method does not delete logs.

This results in orphaned log files being left in the users swift
account. The user gets charged for storage and it can be hard to
identify these log files for manual deletion by the user.

This patch deletes the log files from swift or local filesystem
(depending upon the config setting).

Change-Id: I8d799cc9a63851685766a7dec3bc4b806d688911
Closes-bug: 1457682

commit_message:
Adding ACL check when new stored key order is submitted

Addressing case when new stored key order is requested and container used in
order is marked private via ACL. In that case, only creator user of container
and user(s) with 'read' ACL on container can request new order. For new order,
existing checks are still valid. 1) order project and container project needs
to be same. 2) user need to have 'admin' or 'creator' role as defined in
orders:post policy rule.

Change-Id: I6b21aec8cc62de2ed6b1cc1ee878d756892c414d
Closes-bug: #1446266

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-01 05:18:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Moved all of group_vars into a variable file

Moved all of the group_vars/all.yml file into its own variable file
This change was done to allow a user to override basic options
without having to modify the default group variable files. While
the group_vars/all.yml file is still present it is only holding the
revision information that is used for release data and the minial
required kernel that allows the system to funciton using VXLAN.

Closes-Bug: #1460516
Change-Id: I8e42bb124827bb276134d662c9a171db8e4c017e
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-06-01 05:32:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Moved all of group_vars into a variable file

This change was done to allow a user to override basic options
without having to modify the default group variable files. While
the group_vars/all.yml file is still present it is only holding the
revision information that is used for release data and the minial
required kernel that allows the system to funciton using VXLAN.

The upgrade script was modified to support the new "default"
user_group_vars.yml file.

Closes-Bug: #1460516

commit_message:
Moved all of group_vars into a variable file

Moved all of the group_vars/all.yml file into its own variable file
This change was done to allow a user to override basic options
without having to modify the default group variable files. While
the group_vars/all.yml file is still present it is only holding the
revision information that is used for release data and the minimal
required kernel that allows the system to function using VXLAN.

The upgrade script was modified to support the new "default"
user_group_vars.yml file.

tempest_swift_enabled was set to true in group_vars, so this has
now been set as a default in the role instead.

Commit 1bd2bc052a36c7f8c28e473d0a37fd29827198b0 implemented the
package URL update for rabbitmq, but not the corresponding sha256
update. This was not noticed due to group_vars overriding the URL
to a previous version, resulting in the above-mentioned commit
taking no effect. This patch therefore also corrects the sha256.

Closes-Bug: #1460516
Closes-Bug: #1460992
Change-Id: I8e42bb124827bb276134d662c9a171db8e4c017e

subject: fields: introduce BaseEnumField to allow subclassing
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-18 16:32:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "fields: introduce BaseEnumField to allow subclassing

Currently, objects will directly instantiate the EnumField
class, passing in the list of valid enum values. This is
sub-optimal as the same enum type may be needed in several
objects, and we want to ensure we're always using the same
list of valid values.

To address this, introduce a BaseEnumField class that provides
the custom __repr__() impl based on the enum values. Make the
existing EnumField subclass this, to allow for continued use
of anonymous enum fields, but discourage its use in favour of
creating named enum fields by directly subclassing BaseEnumField

Change-Id: I83199b0f791d3ac5591c7dfc1d14f4fa706d0a64
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-05-19 13:56:56.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_fields.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/exception.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/fields.py'], 'message': "fields: introduce BaseEnumField to allow subclassing

Currently, objects will directly instantiate the EnumField
class, passing in the list of valid enum values. This is
sub-optimal as the same enum type may be needed in several
objects, and we want to ensure we're always using the same
list of valid values.

To address this, introduce a BaseEnumField class that provides
the custom __repr__() impl based on the enum values. Make the
existing EnumField subclass this, to allow for continued use
of anonymous enum fields, but discourage its use in favour of
creating named enum fields by directly subclassing BaseEnumField

Change-Id: I83199b0f791d3ac5591c7dfc1d14f4fa706d0a64
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
fields: introduce BaseEnumField to allow subclassing

Currently, objects will directly instantiate the EnumField
class, passing in the list of valid enum values. This is
sub-optimal as the same enum type may be needed in several
objects, and we want to ensure we're always using the same
list of valid values.

To address this, introduce a BaseEnumField class that provides
the custom __repr__() impl based on the enum values. Make the
existing EnumField subclass this, to allow for continued use
of anonymous enum fields, but discourage its use in favour of
creating named enum fields by directly subclassing BaseEnumField

Change-Id: I83199b0f791d3ac5591c7dfc1d14f4fa706d0a64

subject: fields: add a FlexibleBoolean field type
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-18 16:32:47.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_fields.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/fields.py'], 'message': "fields: add a FlexibleBoolean field type

The current Boolean field type has a strict interpretation of
truth values which matches the python language interpretation.

For data that comes from the end user though, it is more useful
to have a flexible interpretation, that accepts commonly used
strings like 'yes', 'no', 'on', 'off', etc as handled by the
oslo_utils  bool_from_string() method

Since the Boolean field is part of the ABI/API, we cannot
change its semantics, so this introduces new FlexibleBoolean
and FlexibleBooleanField classes

Change-Id: Id785cdd99eca5ac469db9d7b4759957461873cee
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
fields: add a FlexibleBoolean field type

The current Boolean field type has a strict interpretation of
truth values which matches the python language interpretation.

For data that comes from the end user though, it is more useful
to have a flexible interpretation, that accepts commonly used
strings like 'yes', 'no', 'on', 'off', etc as handled by the
oslo_utils  bool_from_string() method

Since the Boolean field is part of the ABI/API, we cannot
change its semantics, so this introduces new FlexibleBoolean
and FlexibleBooleanField classes

Change-Id: Id785cdd99eca5ac469db9d7b4759957461873cee

commit_message:
IBP: delete file if directory with the same name should be created

Initially, makedirs_if_not_exists checks only existence of directory
and if the file with the same name exists it will fail to create
a directory.

This change adds removing of this file to create a directory.

Change-Id: I1007edde58bcd64b501720fe267bb542a408955f
Closes-Bug: #1459665

subject: Fixed errors in ceilometer volume data collection
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-28 04:55:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fixes two issues when get volume size from ceilometer side
Issue 1: If no volume data can be collected from ceilometer side in current period,
then the action of getting volume size in ck-process will get stuck in an infinite loop.
Issue 2: An exception was thrown when the action of getting volume size in ck-process was triggered,
of course the volume size can't be retrieved at that moment. The exception in the ck-process log is:
---WARNING cloudkitty.orchestrator [-] Error while collecting service volume: user_id---

Fixes Bug1459479

Change-Id: I77716b53b41849ebc7cc206e6f966df0ac69ba9e
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-05-29 15:52:18.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkitty/collector/ceilometer.py'], 'message': "Fixed errors in ceilometer volume data collection

The raise of the NoDataCollected exception wasn't triggered.
The resource metadatas weren't collected, causing the orchestrator to
catch an unknown error and keep retrying.

Change-Id: I77716b53b41849ebc7cc206e6f966df0ac69ba9e
Closes-Bug: #1459479
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fixed errors in ceilometer volume data collection

The raise of the NoDataCollected exception wasn't triggered.
The resource metadatas weren't collected, causing the orchestrator to
catch an unknown error and keep retrying.

Change-Id: I77716b53b41849ebc7cc206e6f966df0ac69ba9e
Closes-Bug: #1459479

commit_message:
Handle Disk IO error Exception in swift account auditor

Swift account auditor fails to quarantine corrupt db due to
Disk IO error. This patch fixes that by handling Disk IO Error
Exception.

Closes-Bug:1169189

commit_message:
Nodes UIDs are string not number

We add node uid as integer, but for mcollective is just string name 'number',
because it is name. For example, master node in case of mcollective is 'master'
and cluent node '1', not 1

Details:

* collect information about failed nodes as strings;
* fix tests: return string uids instead of integer.

Change-Id: I714eb7aeeda4350df009f10dbd6e02addef00c9a
Closes-Bug: #1455385

commit_message:
Update rootwrap.conf to add /usr/local/bin

When working with OVN i found on Fedora 21 that
my ovs-vsctl is installed in /usr/local/bin, since this wasnt in
rootwrap DHCP didnt work properly.
This change adds it to rootwrap

Change-Id: Ib3646933744ca6b20ecd5ad0cedcedb4f1fa5f12

commit_message:
Bump WSME to >= 0.7

WSME 0.7 was released fixing a bunch of bugs including one where
installing WSME does not install its dependencies. This broke Ironic
(and possibly other OpenStack services)[1], by requiring WSME >= 0.7
we can finally remove the workaround from the Ironic code.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/184429/

Change-Id: I28861178fac89e6f3fabd34b048f53b6506eda5e

commit_message:
Add SSL/TLS Support

This patch adds SSL/TLS support by passing an SSLContext into the flask
app.run command if the operator sets use_ssl=True in the configuration
file. Operators also have the option to pass in paths to a
certificate and key to load their own certificate chain, via the
ssl_key_path and ssl_cert_path configuration options.

Change-Id: I67792722129645e1f452c7d7d04e7c9d26176e0a
Closes-Bug: #1413204

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-19 22:05:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/cells/test_cells_rpc_driver.py', 'nova/cells/rpc_driver.py'], 'message': 'Fix cells rpc connection leak

Only create a Transport object once for each inter-cell hop.  This
prevents the cells rpc driver from creating a new connection pool
(and connection) for each inter-cell message sent.  This affects the
RabbitMQ and qpid transports.

This is a regression introduced by oslo.messaging commit
f3370da11a867bae287d7f549a671811e8b399ef which got rid stateful
tracking of connection pool references within oslo.messaging.
It is now the responsibility of the caller to manage these
references.

See related bug:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1397925

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/cells/test_cells_rpc_driver.py

NOTE(mriedem): This is due to the tests being moved in Kilo.

Change-Id: Id1e75f456d4c0ef5b87bf3efe810e9fcfa4cce1d
Closes-Bug: #1417745
(cherry picked from commit aac3b4b7e2e0bd20e8044f716068637329e48feb)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix cells rpc connection leak

Only create a Transport object once for each inter-cell hop.  This
prevents the cells rpc driver from creating a new connection pool
(and connection) for each inter-cell message sent.  This affects the
RabbitMQ and qpid transports.

This is a regression introduced by oslo.messaging commit
f3370da11a867bae287d7f549a671811e8b399ef which got rid stateful
tracking of connection pool references within oslo.messaging.
It is now the responsibility of the caller to manage these
references.

See related bug:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1397925

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/cells/test_cells_rpc_driver.py

NOTE(mriedem): This is due to the tests being moved in Kilo.

Change-Id: Id1e75f456d4c0ef5b87bf3efe810e9fcfa4cce1d
Closes-Bug: #1417745
(cherry picked from commit aac3b4b7e2e0bd20e8044f716068637329e48feb)

commit_message:
Add 'fasteners' package

This small package/library provides a reader, writer lock
and a interprocess lock; both taskflow and oslo.concurrency
and tooz have this code and moving it out to its own repository will
allow all of those projects to get rid of there own version while
making it easier to use these locking concept without having to
drag in the dependencies of taskflow or oslo.concurrency or tooz.

- Is the library actively maintained
  * Yes by me @ https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners
- Is the library good code
  * I certainly hope so!
- Is the library python 3 compatible
  * Yes
- Is the library automatically tested
  * Yes (by travis)
- Is the library license compatible
  * ASL 2.0
- Is the library already packaged in the distros we target
  * No
- Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries?
  * Somewhat, oslo.concurrency has a version of this, so does tooz,
    so does taskflow. This repackaging and split-off let's others in the
    non-oslo/openstack world use this package without requiring
    oslo.config (and a bunch of other oslo.* dependencies).

Change-Id: I1e22d52b7186fac97fef30748e40cbd49c5f10b4

Bumps pysaml2 to 2.4.0

It seems that pysaml2 2.0.0 makes keystone-all crash. This
intends to fix that.

commit_message:
Add sqlalchemy-utils to requirements

This library is actively maintained, last release is 5 days old.
This library is good code.
This library is BSD licensed.
This library is (being) packaged (already used by Gnocchi).
This library function is not covered by other libraries.
This library is going to be used by Ceilometer.

Change-Id: I1bd9e9cde33c08d6a7efd69ec2efec342d3487fd

subject: Use best logging practices
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-01 19:37:27.000000000', 'files': ['bandit/core/node_visitor.py', 'bandit/core/config.py', 'bandit/core/manager.py', 'bandit/core/test_set.py', 'bandit/core/tester.py', 'bandit/core/result_store.py', 'bandit/bandit.py', 'bandit/core/meta_ast.py'], 'message': 'Use best logging practices

Interpolating strings into logging statements directly is not considered
best practice for either the logging library or for OpenStack. There
were also a number of different styles of interpolation being used for
the logging statements. All statements are now normalized to the current
best practice.

Change-Id: I37bf5ad1e20c395a80b8c30810d5ace422c8a2a8
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use best logging practices

Interpolating strings into logging statements directly is not considered
best practice for either the logging library or for OpenStack. There
were also a number of different styles of interpolation being used for
the logging statements. All statements are now normalized to the current
best practice.

Change-Id: I37bf5ad1e20c395a80b8c30810d5ace422c8a2a8

commit_message:
Smooth over some differences with six

In the effort to port bandit to python 3, we need to start depending on
some tools to make the porting easier. This adds a dependency on six and
takes care of the two cases where we call iteritems.

Change-Id: I2e687713de7f910104ab1f7c62e7c677052993c4

commit_message:
Ignore cover directory from git

The cover directory holds autogenerated coverage reports that should
not be checked into git and should therefore go in the gitignore file.

Change-Id: I4f7225b5422493f99bc534d6ac622e0703781e6d

subject: Deprecate strtime
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1297, 'name': 'Joshua Harlow', 'email': 'jxharlow@godaddy.com', 'username': 'harlowja'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 9107, 'name': 'Victor Stinner', 'email': 'vstinner@redhat.com', 'username': 'haypo'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-01-20 11:11:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Deprecate strtime

This patches deprecated strtime() as it's a either useless or a very bad
idea to use it.

It's useless because it's 3 lines wrapper around utcnow(),
datetime.strftime() and isotime() which does not bring as it can be
replaced by one line of code in all cases.

It's a bad idea because contrary to what one could expect:

strtime() != isotime(subsecond=True)
strtime(dt) != isotime(dt, subsecond=True)

So it's really best to use isotime() instead of strtime in all cases, so
you are sure that if you end up comparing timestamps as string (i.e. in
tests) you are sure it's going to work, including the timezone.

Change-Id: I8b5119e64369ccac3423dccc04421f99912df733
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-01-22 12:37:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Deprecate strtime

", 'number': 6}, {'created': '2015-05-13 12:56:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Deprecate strtime

This patches deprecated strtime() as it's a either useless or a very bad
idea to use it.

It's useless because it's 3 lines wrapper around utcnow(),
datetime.strftime() and isotime() which does not bring as it can be
replaced by one line of code in all cases.

It's a bad idea because contrary to what one could expect:

strtime() != isotime(subsecond=True)
strtime(dt) != isotime(dt, subsecond=True)

Also, it does not include any timezone information so it loses essential
information on the datetime object.

So it's really best to use isoformat() instead of strtime() in all
cases, so you are sure that if you end up comparing timestamps as string
(i.e. in tests) you are sure it's going to work, including the timezone.

Change-Id: I8b5119e64369ccac3423dccc04421f99912df733

It's a bad idea because contrary to what one could expect:

strtime() != isotime(subsecond=True)
strtime(dt) != isotime(dt, subsecond=True)

Also, it does not include any timezone information so it loses essential
information on the datetime object.

So it's really best to use isoformat() instead of strtime() in all
cases, so you are sure that if you end up comparing timestamps as string
(i.e. in tests) you are sure it's going to work, including the timezone.

It's a bad idea because contrary to what one could expect:

strtime() != isotime(subsecond=True)
strtime(dt) != isotime(dt, subsecond=True)

Also, it does not include any timezone information so it loses essential
information on the datetime object.

So it's really best to use isoformat() instead of strtime() in all
cases, so you are sure that if you end up comparing timestamps as string
(i.e. in tests) you are sure it's going to work, including the timezone.

Change-Id: I8b5119e64369ccac3423dccc04421f99912df733
", 'number': 9}]
commit_message:
Deprecate strtime

This patches deprecated strtime() as it's a either useless or a very bad
idea to use it.

It's useless because it's a 3 lines wrapper around utcnow(),
datetime.strftime() and isotime() so does not bring anything useful as
it can be replaced by one line of code in all cases.

It's a bad idea because contrary to what one could expect:

strtime() != isotime(subsecond=True)
strtime(dt) != isotime(dt, subsecond=True)

Also, it does not include any timezone information so it loses essential
information on the datetime object.

So it's really best to use isoformat() instead of strtime() in all
cases, so you are sure that if you end up comparing timestamps as string
(i.e. in tests) you are sure it's going to work, including the timezone.

Change-Id: I8b5119e64369ccac3423dccc04421f99912df733

commit_message:
Limit max length of gen_random_resource_name

For example flavor name couldn't be longer than 25 chars (in Horizon).
This patch take last 'maxlen' characters of string, because there is
randomly generated part of whole string.

Closes-Bug: 1461118
Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing
Change-Id: I8e7e6ddb3213bd096df7a3ad8377c3d5ea677220

commit_message:
Refactors swift metrics into separate check

This patch separates out swift metrics into separate checks. Earlier
all the swift metrics which were wrapped around icinga were part
of service plugin. With this, the status and messages of each diagnostic
was part of value_meta. This causes shortcoming since alarm definition
cannot be based on value_meta.

With this change, all the swift metrics are now part of separate check,
which each of values gauged separately. The services are still part of
detection plugin.

Change-Id: I53934858c07450bce33290e48adfde65949bd0c4

commit_message:
Remove customized pyX.Y tox requirements

Instead of having custom pyX.Y that test a specific set of
requirements and similar with other tox envs, just enable
more test-requirements directly, in a later change we will
use environment markers to denote the differences.

Also tweaks the jobboard example to bypass/hack a needed eventlet
fix into it so that it actually runs without breaking/never finishing.
A TODO note has been left to eventually (someday?) remove this hack
when it is no longer needed.

Part of fix for bug 1445827

Change-Id: I0fb669f0bdfbe4fe81d89234173f2c3ac4d06de6

commit_message:
Refactor type_gre.vxlan tests to reduce duplicate code

gre and vxlan type drivers unittests have similar tests. This change
abstracts these tests and moves them to TunnelTypeTestMixin[1].

[1] neutron.tests.unit.plugins.ml2.drivers.base_type_tunnel

Change-Id: I13b0507991e840ff34de7ed7ffd31d359691b0ca

commit_message:
Don't wait for an event on a resize-revert

Since we never unplugged, the event ain't comin'.

Sadly, the test that covers this was pretty wrong on multiple fronts,
which this patch fixes up.

Closes-Bug: #1450624
Change-Id: Id515137747a4b76e9b7057c95f80c8ae74017519
(cherry picked from commit 4814e9126ec19a1edfa9c696138c4b3fec71aa0d)

commit_message:
Remove 'select *' from measurements query for Influxdb

Use 'select value, value_meta' for Influxdb measurements query.
Relies on fact that we always store value_meta.

Change-Id: Ic8891542c0abfc849e6f9f52ecfb48ea1ea2a6db

commit_message:
Updated RabbitMQ to the new release version

This change updates master to use the latest stable version of
RabbitMQ. This change is to open up new dev work in master and
potentially other releases which will allow us to evaluate the
update of this supporting service.

This change also removes the group_vars override of the role's
rabbitmq package URL as the override doesn't have the appropriate
sha256 to accompany it.

Closes-Bug: #1460992
Change-Id: Ia8a65c722b8ae4da1afd0628e16bb2bb276a781c
(cherry picked from commit 1bd2bc052a36c7f8c28e473d0a37fd29827198b0)

Also, added some more robust error handling for buggy validators.
A broken validator will now cause Anchor to fail-closed and deny
a certificate, exactly as if that validator test had failed
normally.

A message is logged giving information about the error and a 500
is returned to the calling service with minimal information.

Change-Id: Iddbd0e831a52cc02cc569f220aebf82bd59554d0
', 'number': 5}]
commit_message:
Validator chains now exit on the first error

Also, added some more robust error handling for buggy validators.
A broken validator will now cause Anchor to fail-closed and deny
a certificate, exactly as if that validator test had failed
normally.

A message is logged giving information about the error and a 500
is returned to the calling service with minimal information.

Change-Id: Iddbd0e831a52cc02cc569f220aebf82bd59554d0

commit_message:
Updated repo server deps

This updates the deps that need to be on the repo server to ensure
that all of the python sources are built correctly. The additional
packages are in response to an upstream package dep
`python-qpid-proton` which is now requiring these items.

Change-Id: I6d6f70734fd46c4055f49fdf25035d2b4b212414
(cherry picked from commit 125b0d01b0dc0274fad120f6be0844bddccd0b89)

Set the log directory accordingly

This changes the log directory within the upstart init scripts
such that they are being set throughout the roles and removes an
assumed variable name as the name of the log directory.

commit_message:
Update rabbitmq package sha256 and remove group_vars rabbitmq_package_url

Commit 1bd2bc052a36c7f8c28e473d0a37fd29827198b0 implemented the package URL
update, but not the corresponding sha256 update. This patch corrects that.

This patch also removed the group_vars rabbitmq_package_url as it overrides
the role variable but does not have a corresponding sha256, causing a
download failure and confusion regarding the failure.

Change-Id: I3d7ac84c04c51af4a2861e23164758545de4850a
Closes-Bug: #1460992

commit_message:
fix ansible libary passing error arguments.

kolla is mandatory to run a version of docker-compose that 
includes pid: host support.docker-compose 1.3.0 to include the
necessary features.

docker-compose 1.3.0 project.up() abandoned the parameters 
detach and use allow_recreate replace recreate parameters.
closes-Bug: #1458116

Change-Id: I1235da58db5bedf208ebaea2a54568964dc802f8

This reverts commit c3a88a578f3e484b5dc2a227a46e8546e581f8a3.
Due to an introduced a regression[1]:
In case where neutron was configured to have more than one DHCP agent per
network (dhcp_agents_per_network<=2), dnsmasq rejects leases of others
dnsmasq instances. Some clients do not check server-id for those NAKs,
failing to set an address.
The reverted commit originally came to fix the issue[2] with DHCPNAKs sent
after neutron-dhcp-agent restart. This issue is expected to be fixed by a
separate patch[3].
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1457900
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1345947
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/185486
Related-Bug: 1457900
Related-Bug: 1345947

Change-Id: I45683d5201b066237af2debc9cdca91f6c0c6e1e
', 'number': 4}]
commit_message:
Revert "Pass '--dhcp-authoritative' option to dnsmasq"

This reverts commit c3a88a578f3e484b5dc2a227a46e8546e581f8a3.
Due to an introduced a regression[1]:
In case where neutron was configured to have more than one DHCP agent per
network (dhcp_agents_per_network<=2), dnsmasq rejects leases of others
dnsmasq instances. Some clients do not check server-id for those NAKs,
failing to set an address.
The reverted commit originally came to fix the issue[2] with DHCPNAKs sent
after neutron-dhcp-agent restart. This issue is expected to be fixed by a
separate patch[3].
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1457900
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1345947
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/185486
Related-Bug: 1457900
Related-Bug: 1345947

Change-Id: I45683d5201b066237af2debc9cdca91f6c0c6e1e

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-15 22:31:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/ipsec.py'], 'message': 'VPNaaS: Fix breakage in status reporting

In the plugin, the status for the VPN service and its connections
are only updated if there is a change in the status or if the
pending_status_update flag is set. This flag is supposed to be
set when the status changes and the database has the resource in
PENDING_* state.

In the failure case, when the connection is created, the service
and connection are in PENDING_CREATE state in the plugin. In the
device driver, because of the create the service is set to ACTIVE
and its pending_status_update flag is set. The connection will be
in either DOWN or ACTIVE state and the pending_status_update_flag
is set. This is as expected.

When the device driver is about to report, it reads the latest
status and updates it, before reporting. This is where the bug
occurred.

Because of the recent change for translating the FQDN of peer to
IP address, if that fails, it attempts to set the status to ERROR
and force an update by setting updated_pending_status (so that it
updates, even if in pending state). However, the implementation
is set the updated_pending_status flag based on this "force" flag,
which is by default, false.

As a result, the flag gets cleared before the first report is sent
and the connection is never updated from then on (because it never
checks again to see if in PENDING_* state).

The fix is to simply only update the pending_status_update, when
the forced flag is set, otherwise leave it alone so that the flag
is not cleared on the first report.

In the future, this shoudl be reworked to a simpler mechanism that
just checks previous vs current status and reports any change, and
the plugin unconditionally updates the status.

Change-Id: Id49e54c49f3c72f676b6f2513288c0eae2c6db7b
Closes-Bug: #1440655
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
VPNaaS: Fix breakage in status reporting

In the plugin, the status for the VPN service and its connections
are only updated if there is a change in the status or if the
pending_status_update flag is set. This flag is supposed to be
set when the status changes and the database has the resource in
PENDING_* state.

In the failure case, when the connection is created, the service
and connection are in PENDING_CREATE state in the plugin. In the
device driver, because of the create the service is set to ACTIVE
and its pending_status_update flag is set. The connection will be
in either DOWN or ACTIVE state and the pending_status_update_flag
is set. This is as expected.

When the device driver is about to report, it reads the latest
status and updates it, before reporting. This is where the bug
occurred.

Because of the recent change for translating the FQDN of peer to
IP address, if that fails, it attempts to set the status to ERROR
and force an update by setting updated_pending_status (so that it
updates, even if in pending state). However, the implementation
is set the updated_pending_status flag based on this "force" flag,
which is by default, false.

As a result, the flag gets cleared before the first report is sent
and the connection is never updated from then on (because it never
checks again to see if in PENDING_* state).

The fix is to simply only update the pending_status_update, when
the forced flag is set, otherwise leave it alone so that the flag
is not cleared on the first report.

In the future, this shoudl be reworked to a simpler mechanism that
just checks previous vs current status and reports any change, and
the plugin unconditionally updates the status.

Change-Id: Id49e54c49f3c72f676b6f2513288c0eae2c6db7b
Closes-Bug: #1440655

commit_message:
Process port IP requests before subnet requests

When a port requests multiple fixed IPs, process the requests
for specific IP addresses before the ones asking for a subnet.
This prevents an error where the IP that was requested happens
to be the next up for allocation so the subnet request takes it
and causes a DBDuplicateEntry.

Closes-Bug: #1459467
Change-Id: I645565c7fe0c47c58d686b25020bb49a0b9089f5
(cherry picked from commit 817b45b6406d9730859535ac54d73ec5c85451d0)

revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-28 07:40:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Persist DHCP leases to a local database

Due to issues caused by dnsmasq restarts sending DHCPNAKs,
change Ieff0236670c1403b5d79ad8e50d7574c1b694e34 passed the
'dhcp-authoritative' option to dnsmasq. While this solved the
restart issue, it broke the multi-DHCP server scenario because
the dnsmasq instances will NAK requests to a server ID that
isn't their own.

Problem DHCP Request Lifecycle:

Client: DHCPDISCOVER(broadcast)
Server1: DHCPOFFER
Server2: DHCPOFFER
Client: DHCPREQUEST(broadcast with Server-ID=Server1)
Server1: DHCPACK
Server2: DHCPNAK(in response to observed DHCPREQUEST with other Server-ID)
          ^---Causes issues

This change removes the authoritative option so NAKs are not
send in response to DHCPREQUEST's to other servers. To handle
the original issue that Ieff0236670c1403b5d79ad8e50d7574c1b694e34
was inteded to address, this patch also allows changes to be persisted
to a local lease file.

In order to handle the issue where a DHCP server may be scheduled
to another agent, a fake lease file is generated for dnsmasq to start
with. The contents are populated based on all of the known ports for
a network. This should prevent dnsmasq from NAKing clients renewing
leases issued before it was restarted/rescheduled.

Closes-Bug: #1457900
Change-Id: Idc91602bf8c474467e596cbd5cbaa8898952c841
(cherry picked from commit 4aba83fd22c8880a2d24f27e43a32cc164abe3e0)

Server1: DHCPACK
Server2: DHCPNAK(in response to observed DHCPREQUEST with other Server-ID)
          ^---Causes issues

This change removes the authoritative option so NAKs are not

was inteded to address, this patch also allows changes to be persisted

In order to handle the issue where a DHCP server may be scheduled
to another agent, a fake lease file is generated for dnsmasq to start

a network. This should prevent dnsmasq from NAKing clients renewing
leases issued before it was restarted/rescheduled.

Closes-Bug: #1457900

commit_message:
Persist DHCP leases to a local database

Due to issues caused by dnsmasq restarts sending DHCPNAKs,
change Ieff0236670c1403b5d79ad8e50d7574c1b694e34 passed the
'dhcp-authoritative' option to dnsmasq. While this solved the
restart issue, it broke the multi-DHCP server scenario because
the dnsmasq instances will NAK requests to a server ID that
isn't their own.

Problem DHCP Request Lifecycle:

Client: DHCPDISCOVER(broadcast)
Server1: DHCPOFFER
Server2: DHCPOFFER
Client: DHCPREQUEST(broadcast with Server-ID=Server1)
Server1: DHCPACK
Server2: DHCPNAK(in response to observed DHCPREQUEST with other Server-ID)
          ^---Causes issues

This change removes the authoritative option so NAKs are not
send in response to DHCPREQUEST's to other servers. To handle
the original issue that Ieff0236670c1403b5d79ad8e50d7574c1b694e34
was inteded to address, this patch also allows changes to be persisted
to a local lease file.

In order to handle the issue where a DHCP server may be scheduled
to another agent, a fake lease file is generated for dnsmasq to start
with. The contents are populated based on all of the known ports for
a network. This should prevent dnsmasq from NAKing clients renewing
leases issued before it was restarted/rescheduled.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/unit/test_linux_dhcp.py - Subnet ID had to be added
    to the fake ports so they weren't skipped

Closes-Bug: #1457900
Change-Id: Idc91602bf8c474467e596cbd5cbaa8898952c841
(cherry picked from commit 4aba83fd22c8880a2d24f27e43a32cc164abe3e0)

commit_message:
Change external resources to https where possible

This change updates all of the external URLs to use HTTPS where
possible. the change will create a more secure deployment by default.

Change-Id: I4d53c021904208bffb0d597c7ae53bbd00f40209
Closes-Bug: 1411331

commit_message:
ipv6 compatibility issue, make sure we do not handle in the controller
any subnet that is not ipv4, ipv6 is offloaded to the Normal path
Add a casting call function for add_flow_normal_local_subnet and add a
inner check for ipv4, this was needed because we access the code before
calling the inner func

Change-Id: I0024b6f5da8a775dbd70d3ca7dfcbf98a63101e1

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 5170, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V CI', 'email': 'hyper-v_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'hyper-v-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}, {'_account_id': 7491, 'name': 'Viktor Serhieiev', 'email': 'viktor.sergeyev@gmail.com', 'username': 'vsergeyev'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 9420, 'name': 'Matthew Gilliard', 'email': 'matthew.gilliard@hp.com', 'username': 'gilliard'}, {'_account_id': 9555, 'name': 'Matthew Booth', 'email': 'mbooth@redhat.com', 'username': 'MatthewBooth'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11103, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'otc_cloud@163.com', 'username': 'intelotccloud', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2014-11-21 16:28:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix the principal race in db.security_group_ensure_default()

The code checked for the existence of the group, and if it didn't
exist it expected that creation would succeed. A failure was handled
by any code calling security_group_ensure_default(), which would catch
the exception and try to fetch the group a second time. However, it
wasn't handled by instance_create(), which would fail in this
situation.

This change handles the race by explicitly relying on the atomicity of
group creation. We also retry more than once, but bound the retries to
prevent a livelock.

The race condition test is updated accordingly. We also add a new test
for the livelock situation.

The function also contains a race in how it updates quota. This is a
larger, more general problem to be handled separately.

Change-Id: I08bcd0329b81bec63983631067d2b9cc0e8f6df3
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-01-16 13:45:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fix the principal race in db.security_group_ensure_default()

The code checked for the existence of the group, and if it didn't
exist it expected that creation would succeed. A failure was handled
by any code calling security_group_ensure_default(), which would catch
the exception and try to fetch the group a second time. However, it
wasn't handled by instance_create(), which would fail in this
situation.

This change handles the race by explicitly relying on the atomicity of
group creation. We also retry more than once, but bound the retries to
prevent a livelock.

The race condition test is updated accordingly. We also add a new test
for the livelock situation.

The function also contains a race in how it updates quota. This is a
larger, more general problem to be handled separately.

Change-Id: I08bcd0329b81bec63983631067d2b9cc0e8f6df3
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-01-19 14:45:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova/exception.py', 'nova/tests/unit/db/test_db_api.py', 'nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Cleanup db.security_group_ensure_default()

Rename _security_group_ensure_default() to
_security_group_get_default() to reflect its usage.
security_group_ensure_default() retains its name as its return value
is never used.

Combine race handling into _security_group_get_default() rather than
splitting it across 2 functions where it might be missed.

Wrap _security_group_create() in a nested transaction to ensure it can
fail in a race without aborting the whole transaction.

Consequently, remove the redundant call to
security_group_ensure_default in instance_create, resulting in 1 less
select during instance_create.

We also add a test that instance_create creates the default security
group if necessary, which was previously missing.

Change-Id: I08bcd0329b81bec63983631067d2b9cc0e8f6df3
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Cleanup db.security_group_ensure_default()

Rename _security_group_ensure_default() to
_security_group_get_default() to reflect its usage.
security_group_ensure_default() retains its name as its return value
is never used.

Combine race handling into _security_group_get_default() rather than
splitting it across 2 functions where it might be missed.

Wrap _security_group_create() in a nested transaction to ensure it can
fail in a race without aborting the whole transaction.

Consequently, remove the redundant call to
security_group_ensure_default in instance_create, resulting in 1 less
select during instance_create.

We also add a test that instance_create creates the default security
group if necessary, which was previously missing.

Change-Id: I08bcd0329b81bec63983631067d2b9cc0e8f6df3

commit_message:
Make get_last_tag work on OS X

I run the release tools directly on my laptop in order to have the
launchpad authentication work properly, and OS X uses a different
version of sed than Linux. This patch makes the extended regex stuff
work properly on both platforms.

Change-Id: Id417c7178044dc7d16a347716a73a790bd4cb6e8

Include the SHA of the current HEAD commit on the branch being queried
so we can copy that value to build a script to release the versions
reported. This lets us produce a proposed list of releases, ask the PTLs
to verify them, and then release exactly what we discussed even if it is
a couple of days later and more patches have merged.

Change-Id: I0720b88fc2e8f36310f3b585ff8f89640a8f8b39
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Include HEAD SHA in unreleased log output

Include the SHA of the current HEAD commit on the branch being queried
so we can copy that value to build a script to release the versions
reported. This lets us produce a proposed list of releases, ask the PTLs
to verify them, and then release exactly what we discussed even if it is
a couple of days later and more patches have merged.

Change-Id: I0720b88fc2e8f36310f3b585ff8f89640a8f8b39

commit_message:
Expose base check classes as part of public API

Those classes are used in neutron to implement custom attribute
and sub-attribute checks (get_network:attr:subattr syntax).
Those checks do not belong to oslo.policy since they would be
backwards incompatible with existing behaviour, introducing new
semantics and potentially breaking other projects, like nova.

So the alternative is to expose those symbols as part of public
API for the oslo library and allow other projects to reuse them.

More details on neutron issues consuming the library can be
found at:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-April/061783.html

Related-Bug: #1426082
Change-Id: I6ee9f8f7fcea3ddb2c52b5d58dfce3dd328c9131

 - Configurations allows to define new backup configurations and link them to
   instances
 - Backups shows a list of all succesful backups and allows to restore them
 - Restores shows a history of all restored backups

It communicates with the api server via the client apis (freeezer.client.client).
The "glue code" between client apis and the UI lives in freezer.api.api.

commit_message:
This version contains the following pages:
 - Overview displays charts/reports (Currently only placeholders)
 - Configurations allows to define new backup configurations and link them to
   instances
 - Backups shows a list of all succesful backups and allows to restore them
 - Restores shows a history of all restored backups

It communicates with the api server via the client apis (freeezer.client.client).
The "glue code" between client apis and the UI lives in freezer.api.api.

Implements: Blueprint freezer-api-web-ui
Change-Id: I48cd8cba2b0169c6e64f650233c1a31b91ced34f

commit_message:
Use tar -t instead of -l because centos 6

Centos 6 tar appears to only support unix style tar args. Use tar -t
when we inspect test builds.

commit_message:
Don't log tmpfs message during cleanup

By that point in the build it isn't generally useful, and it causes
confusion when builds fail because people think that's the error.

Change-Id: I26dee4ac0947b71a4a065ef6c5a18103e7df6667

commit_message:
Fix document about Rally with DevStack all-in-one installation

The document about 'Rally with DevStack all-in-one installation'
shows that DevStack uses `localrc`, however DevStack uses `local.conf` now.
This patch fix (`localrc`->`local.conf`) the document.

Change-Id: I8fc707b6d30b2ebbe2643f9eba0b01d8bda817cb
Closes-bug: 1460582

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
ansible libary passing error arguments detach and recreate to project.up().

kolla is mandatory to run a version of docker-compose that includes pid: host support.
docker-compose 1.3.0 to include the necessary features.

docker-compose 1.3.0 project.up() abandoned the parameters detach
use allow_recreate replace recreate parameters.
closes-Bug: #1458116

Change-Id: I88a6a0ef63f71ed7a66db538f2f8bf86586991f8

commit_message:
Catch exception trying to extract test time

The database I am getting back is a gdm database and it does
not have a get method.  Catch the exception and try something
else.  If that blows up, ignore because we'd rather see the
results of our tests.

Change-Id: I2882e19d49f2fb3471669f5eb8a017c5d5ac98c2

commit_message:
API: Add policy enforcement test cases for pci API

in I0ad86604a31feafdb7500b0fdc27b76647c5fcf, we remove db layer admin
enforcement for compute_node_get_all and compute_node_search_by_hypervisor,
but get_by_compute_node is called by pci's index/detail.

This patch add policy enforcement test cases for pci's index/detail method,
together with show.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part
Change-Id: I05e26fe8c61522a276d93ba6bbcece906d97de89

commit_message:
Update bandit to use absolute imports

OpenStack follows the style of using absolute imports in all modules and
explicitly using the package name as well (i.e., avoiding relative
imports). This also aids with the work to add Python 3 compatibility.

Change-Id: Iae448af961e2b672a6de5000cc7a75d6c4668473

subject: Fix --skip-identical to allow identical xLO to replace non-xLO
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-04-30 17:30:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix --skip-identical to allow identical xLO to replace non-xLO

When --skip-identical option is used with an object upload, a
segmented xLO upload will currently not replace a regular object
with the same content. Similarly a non-segmented upload will not
replace an existing manifest pointing to segments that compose to
have the same content.

This patch makes --skip-identical option be ignored if the existing
object is a manifest and the upload is not, and vice-versa.

Plus drive-by fix to add account_username option to sample.conf for
funtional tests.

Change-Id: I90cfdef0d97a2aa16275d1cf69a6176ae12e6d2b
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-05-01 09:02:40.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_service.py', 'tests/sample.conf', 'swiftclient/service.py'], 'message': 'Fix --skip-identical to allow identical xLO to replace non-xLO

When --skip-identical option is used with an object upload, a
segmented xLO upload will currently not replace a regular object
with the same content. Similarly a non-segmented upload will not
replace an existing manifest pointing to segments that compose to
have the same content.

This patch makes --skip-identical option be ignored if the existing
object is a manifest and the upload is not, and vice-versa.

Plus drive-by fix to add account_username option to sample.conf for
funtional tests.

Change-Id: I90cfdef0d97a2aa16275d1cf69a6176ae12e6d2b
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Fix --skip-identical to allow identical xLO to replace non-xLO

When --skip-identical option is used with an object upload, a
segmented xLO upload will currently not replace a regular object
with the same content. Similarly a non-segmented upload will not
replace an existing manifest pointing to segments that compose to
have the same content.

This patch makes --skip-identical option be ignored if the existing
object is a manifest and the upload is not, and vice-versa.

Plus drive-by fix to add account_username option to sample.conf for
funtional tests.

Change-Id: I90cfdef0d97a2aa16275d1cf69a6176ae12e6d2b

When an invalid configuration file is specified (i.e. python
file), bandit prints a traceback. This change handles the

commit_message:
Handle exception when invalid config file is specified

When an invalid configuration file is specified (i.e. python
file), bandit prints a traceback. This change handles the
yaml parse exception and informs the user the configuration file
is invalid.

Change-Id: Id057c19ebddb16316c8b6e80cead51058a6172fd
Closes-bug: #1435422

commit_message:
Add proxy support for url_available

In order to support deployments that are configuring proxies for
their yum/apt repositories, we need to also support proxies for the
repo connectivity_tests task. This change adds the support to pass
in a proxy to use when checking the url availability.

Change-Id: Id363c12c35f35b07e280f196091f71cfe91b7311
Related-Bug: 1460169
Related-Bug: 1460108

commit_message:
Updated RabbitMQ to the new release version

This change updates master to use the latest stable version of
RabbitMQ. This change is to open up new dev work in master and
potentially other releases which will allow us to evaluate the
update of this supporting service.

Change-Id: Ia8a65c722b8ae4da1afd0628e16bb2bb276a781c

commit_message:
ironic-discoverd is being renamed to ironic-inspector

This patch changes module names, allows importing new module
name for inspector (will be later changed to ironic_inspector_client).

We need this patch to unbreak devstack support.

Change-Id: I34cc4336dcd7e8d44aebecf5c85b52c83f0c717b

[{'created': '2015-06-01 12:54:44.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/database/database.pp', 'deployment/puppet/openstack/manifests/galera/status.pp'], 'message': 'Restrict access to the galera clustercheck

W/o this fix the galera clustercheck script may
be reached via http from any internal or external
network. This is a security issue.
The solution is to allow access to the clustercheck
from only the management network, localhost and IP
240.0.0.2 which is reserved for internal haproxy usage.

Note, the management network CIDR is extracted from the
network scheme endpoint address for the br-mgmt interface.
It is represented in CIDR as <IP>/<mask> and this works
as the xinetd only_from configuration directive just fine.

Related-bug: #1460623

Change-Id: I8195b8a5b2b87e27b82e067d8dac0895cb6663e7
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Restrict access to the galera clustercheck

W/o this fix the galera clustercheck script may
be reached via http from any internal or external
network. This is a security issue.
The solution is to allow access to the clustercheck
from only the management network, localhost and IP
240.0.0.2 which is reserved for internal haproxy usage.

Note, the management network CIDR is extracted from the
network scheme endpoint address for the br-mgmt interface.
It is represented in CIDR as <IP>/<mask> and this works
as the xinetd only_from configuration directive just fine.

Related-bug: #1460623

Change-Id: I8195b8a5b2b87e27b82e067d8dac0895cb6663e7
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Move pool dispose() before os.fork

Currently pool dispose() is done after os.fork, but this will
produce shared DB connections in child processes which may lead
to DB errors.

Move pool dispose() before os.fork. This will remove all existing
connections in the parent process and child processes will create
their own new ones.

Change-Id: Ie36417a64f0eb39b53dad61517f834aec37bacfb
Closes-Bug: 1458718

commit_message:
Editing all text messages in all tests for Ceilometer

1. All text messages were edited so that users can understand
   why the test failed or was skipped.
2. Some spelling errors were fixed.
3. Some tests had incomplete description of scenario. Missing steps
   were added.

Closes-Bug: #1459994

Change-Id: I8bdf8e74601a47f83f87ef2342e23593f13992fe

commit_message:
Fixing "fail" message in platform Sahara test

In addition, expected duration of the test was reduced from 3600
to 1200. 3600 seconds is too much for this test. This test takes
no more than 600 seconds even on swarm jobs.

subject: Replace MIDONET_ENABLE_Q_SVC_ONLY with sample conf
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-01 04:21:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Replace MIDONET_ENABLE_Q_SVC_ONLY with sample conf

MIDONET_ENABLE_Q_SVC_ONLY env variable is used as a convenient way to
only start Neutron services. However, the same could be achieved simply
by specifying in local.conf which servers to run, and by doing so, it
would be more explicit to the users which services are actually running.
This patch replaces MIDONET_ENABLE_Q_SVC_ONLY with a sample local.conf
file that does the following:

 * Start the core OpenStack dependencies (mysql, rabbit, keystone)
 * Start Neutron, Nova, Glance
 * Start Tempest (since this would be useful in CI and local dev)

Change-Id: I4f574fe2c543d5016edaa577c6b17f38313c3971
Implements: MNP-128

commit_message:
Replace MIDONET_ENABLE_Q_SVC_ONLY with sample conf

MIDONET_ENABLE_Q_SVC_ONLY env variable is used as a convenient way to
only start Neutron services. However, the same could be achieved simply
by specifying in local.conf which services to run, and by doing so, it
would be more explicit to the users which ones are actually running.
This patch replaces MIDONET_ENABLE_Q_SVC_ONLY with a sample local.conf
file that does the following:

 * Start the core OpenStack dependencies (mysql, rabbit, keystone)
 * Start Neutron, Nova, Glance
 * Start Tempest (since this would be useful in CI and local dev)

Change-Id: I4f574fe2c543d5016edaa577c6b17f38313c3971
Implements: MNP-128

commit_message:
Use zuul-cloner to clone boostrap dg repo

Before devstack-gate runs we have to clone devstack-gate then start it.
Previously this was a semi complicated JJB macro based on whether or not
the repo exists previously. It also was unaware of the git cache on our
nodes. We can simplify all this and use the git cache by having
zuul-cloner do this initial set up for us.

Change-Id: I512203f35797837e1f4612add05f60b759a6eb07

Overall metadata size constraint is enforced in the container and account
backends as well as in the proxy controllers. Whereas the proxy controller
can check that constraints are not exceeded by a single PUT or POST request,
the backend checks that constraints are not exceeded by the aggregate of all
PUTs and POSTs.

The current functional tests only exercise the proxy controller checks, since
they test for a 400 when sending excessive metadata in a single POST. This patch
adds a test for a 400 when a single metadata item in a POST causes the backend
aggregate constraints check to go over limit.

The extra coverage of the new assertions can be seen by modifying
swift/common/db.DatabasBroker.validate_metadata() to always return None
immediately - only the new assertions fail when functests are run.

Change-Id: I1489e29686013cbd3d70283d8756b548aea3c2e1
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Tighten up overall metadata size tests

Overall metadata size constraint is enforced in the container and account
backends as well as in the proxy controllers. Whereas the proxy controller
can check that constraints are not exceeded by a single PUT or POST request,
the backend checks that constraints are not exceeded by the aggregate of all
PUTs and POSTs.

The current functional tests only exercise the proxy controller checks, since
they test for a 400 when sending excessive metadata in a single POST. This patch
adds a test for a 400 when a single metadata item in a POST causes the backend
aggregate constraints check to go over limit.

The extra coverage of the new assertions can be seen by modifying
swift/common/db.DatabasBroker.validate_metadata() to always return None
immediately - only the new assertions fail when functests are run.

Change-Id: I1489e29686013cbd3d70283d8756b548aea3c2e1

commit_message:
Make vmware driver decode special character in cluster name.

If the cluster name has special character like "/", nova-compute will fail to
retrieve cluster object from VCenter. This change decode the special character
in URI path of the cluster name returned by VSphere API, so that it can make
vmware driver support cluster name like "cluster/01" defined in nova.conf

Closes-Bug:#1412696

Change-Id: I5b54125fbad051a6aac4780a97e4d14165260389

commit_message:
Implement ability to get implemented features of plugin

This change implements ability to get implemented features of each
plugin. Now if we will get plugin information using API, it will
contain new section 'plugin_implements' with implemented features.
When this change will be merged, it's required to update wadl docs with
new information.

Change-Id: I51ab08ba247b10ac48e8726f91f18739f3090394

commit_message:
Use short name for drivers in the keystone installation section

In accordance with commit e7e3ca52 in keystone, with the advent of
stevedore, the use of full class path for driver names is
deprecated. Let's keep things in sync and use the shorter names for
the drivers.

Closes-Bug: 1456359
Change-Id: I6ce45064d97c61cec1996dfe4a28a33e7b003011
Signed-off-by: Cleber Rosa <cleber.gnu@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Cleanup builds

Remove separate build-user-guides.sh and create a new build-all-rst.sh
tool.

Remove networking tox environment, since the RST guides share files, we
should always build them together using the docs tox environment.

Change-Id: I7ef98ca5e134096e14c79d58b0fc62a07747e471

commit_message:
Fixes the order for vxlan example subnet-create

The parameter order in the example command to create
a subnet for a vxlan with the linuxbridge configuration
is incorrect. This patch places the network name to
the correct position.

Change-Id: Id5517f02fc0aa37b455afa4ca1b3c417b4ba7ad1
Closes-Bug: #1460041

subject: Do not assume order of mounts in execute_with_mount
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-06-01 05:53:07.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/tests/unit/services/vpn/common/test_netns_wrapper.py'], 'message': 'Do not assume order of mounts in execute_with_mount

This fixes the unit tests[1] that breaks with a randomized
PYTHONHASHSEED (see the bug report).

The test assumed that the execute_with_mount method[2] performs
filesystem mounts in a particular order. Found with PYTHONHASHSEED=1.

The fix refactors the test case to handle unsorted mounts.

[1] neutron_vpnaas.tests.unit.services.vpn.common.test_netns_wrapper.\
    TestNetnsWrapper.test_netns_wrap
[2] neutron_vpnaas.services.vpn.common.netns_wrapper

Partial-bug: #1348818

Note: There are several other unrelated unit tests that also break with
a randomized PYTHONHASHSEED, but they are not addressed here. They will
be addressed in separate patches.

Change-Id: I164c477f32c6781e9974d4d13a4f91a15b99201c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Do not assume order of mounts in execute_with_mount

This fixes the unit tests[1] that breaks with a randomized
PYTHONHASHSEED (see the bug report).

The test assumed that the execute_with_mount method[2] performs
filesystem mounts in a particular order. Found with PYTHONHASHSEED=1.

The fix refactors the test case to handle unsorted mounts.

[1] neutron_vpnaas.tests.unit.services.vpn.common.test_netns_wrapper.\
    TestNetnsWrapper.test_netns_wrap
[2] neutron_vpnaas.services.vpn.common.netns_wrapper

Partial-bug: #1348818

Note: There are several other unrelated unit tests that also break with
a randomized PYTHONHASHSEED, but they are not addressed here. They will
be addressed in separate patches.

Change-Id: I164c477f32c6781e9974d4d13a4f91a15b99201c

commit_message:
Fix volume creation from image with allowed_direct_url_schemes

When CONF.allowed_direct_url_schemes is set to ['file'] and
Glance image has direct_url or locations metadata with 'file:///'
scheme, cinder tries to directly read the image data from the
local file. However, currently the code is broken because return
value from get_location() has been changed to a tuple.
This fixes the code so that it can handle the metadata correctly.

Change-Id: I39a12a31fbfbd3a9824c67391096f74406d8a749
Closes-Bug: #1437477

commit_message:
Block subnet create when a network hosts subnets allocated from different pools

This change will ensure that all subnets with the same ip_version on a given
network have been allocated from the same subnet pool or no pool. This
provides cleaner subnet overlap detection.

Cherry-picked from 251f551a5fe8fe05cdc8c9b9cfad357245b39bb9

Change-Id: I3c7366c69b10c202c0511126fbee6b3aac36759e
Closes-Bug: #1451559

commit_message:
Refactor resource_fields.py

Refactor the resource_fields.py file to remove some (but not all) of the
duplication that is occurring.

  * Created a class Resource to contain the fields and label values
  * Added test cases for the new Resource class
  * Use the new Resource class to hold data for Chassis, Node, and
    Ports.
  * Have logic to support a 'sort_fields' and 'sort_labels' property
    which removes fields/labels which can not be used for sorting.

Change-Id: I846517a3714b1a86ef7ed7f52e911376e1915bb5

commit_message:
Report status when engine start

After heat engine starts, it won't report its status, so
updated_at is None by then. If heat engine die before its first
status report, its record will not remove from service-list.

Change-Id: I55801ceb12ec8e4a3746799d3d43c6e9c01c6cd8
Closes-Bug: #1459997
(cherry picked from commit 4b9c2caf3b7b44a66b472acae8198c188acba377)

commit_message:
Improve strictness of iLO test cases error checking

The 'spec_set' option of Mock object directs stricter checking than
'spec' option.
The commit cdfcebca1a4f49ec4bd732b21691dbff12a7b101 assigned
'spec_set' to the external functions of proliantutils, but it assigned
'spec' to the internal functions.
This patch makes strictness of the error checking consistent among
iLO test cases.

Change-Id: I478afd25cc25ac7a0f471f92122937b30f500158

commit_message:
Adds inherited column to RoleAssignment PK

It should be possible to add both inherited and
non-inherited role assignments for the same actor
and target with the same role.

However, this was not currently possible since
the inherited column was not part of the PK of
the assignment table.

This patch alters the table definition and adds a
migration script and tests for it.

Closes-Bug: #1403539

Change-Id: I1ba4935934b0dc6b6077d18761023ad50462c8b8

commit_message:
Fix wrong response with version details

Now,Version details for API v2 were being reported as v1.

This patch fixed this bug.

Change-Id: I9698b33210e7d2f89f8a717d0ad2ada3edb4c391

commit_message:
API: remove admin require for compute_node(get_all/search_by_hyperviso) from db

This patch removes require_admin_context decorator for compute_node_get_all and
compute_node_search_by_hypervisor.
Add backward-compatible enforcement in v2 rest api layer for hypervisors api's
index/detail/search/servers method, also add unit test case for this
enforcement.

Note these 2 methods will also been called by pci(v2.1) api, will add more
policy enforcement unit test case in next patch.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part
Change-Id: I0ad86604a31feafdb7500b0fdc27b76647c5fcfd

commit_message:
Use network 'heat-net' for integration_tests

Neutron support for ipv6 is not complete yet (ex. LBaaS
only supports ipv4). We'had some gate issues after dual
stack was enabled in devstack. We had put some tactical
fixes to resolve those[1][2].

This fix adds usage of heat-net/heat-subnet(only ipv4)
for integration tests. This also rolls back the earlier
tactical changes.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/178576
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/178933/

Change-Id: Ia863edb8932b8dea5c4fa110c97dcfdadca85bb9

commit_message:
Pull lbaasv1 tempest tests in-tree, use installed neutron for v1/v2 job

Fix the lbaas v2 api job to use the installed neutron and neutron-lbaas
in CI land. I'm not super happy about tox still being in the mix, so
expect it to run testr directly in a future commit, but the output
gets all horked when I switch, and I'd rather get the job fixed and
tackle that second.

Also pulls in a subset of tempest, to be used during the migration
to tempest-lib. Future test commits need to move us away from the
in-tree tempest, and start removing it.

Also yank the check_bash check, which was removed from neutron.

Change-Id: I2790239b8cd361bc4ac7905b4118f34648b97840

commit_message:
Switch total_resources to use stack_count_total_resources

This change uses database queries to count the total number of
resources in a nested stack tree instead of loading every stack
and every resource in that stack.

This should result in a significant improvement in memory use
for stacks with many nested stacks and resources.

Closes-Bug: #1455589
Change-Id: I8c2f1fa9114dbf68ad4a5f99dd3929b6958b5d7a

subject: Set tenant options on parsed namespace
revisions:
[{'created': '2015-05-31 03:44:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Set tenant options on parsed namespace

Because of the way OSC registers all plugins together we end up
with os-tenant-X parameters being saved to the project-X attribute after
parsing. If you are using the v2 plugins directly then they and os-client-config
expect the tenant_X values and will assuming no scoping information if
they are not present.

Validating options for scope will also fail in this situation, not just
because the resultant auth dictionary is missing the tenant-X
attributes, but because OSC validates that either project or domain
scope information is present.

Fix this by just always setting the v2 parameters if the v3 parameters
are present. This will have no effect on the generic or v3 case but fix
the v2 case.

Expand validation to include the tenant options so it knows that v2
plugins are scoped.

Change-Id: I8cab3e423663f801cbf2d83106c671bddc58d7e6
Closes-Bug: #1460369

commit_message:
Set tenant options on parsed namespace

Because of the way OSC registers all plugins together we end up
with os-tenant-X parameters being saved to the project-X attribute after
parsing. If you are using the v2 plugins directly then they and os-client-config
expect the tenant_X values and will assuming no scoping information if
they are not present.

Validating options for scope will also fail in this situation, not just
because the resultant auth dictionary is missing the tenant-X
attributes, but because OSC validates that either project or domain
scope information is present.

Fix this by just always setting the v2 parameters if the v3 parameters
are present. This will have no effect on the generic or v3 case but fix
the v2 case.

Expand validation to include the tenant options so it knows that v2
plugins are scoped.

Change-Id: I8cab3e423663f801cbf2d83106c671bddc58d7e6
Closes-Bug: #1460369

commit_message:
Fix ipv6 support

There is issue with ipv6 where address has to be in brackets, this causes the
underlying ruby TCPSocket to fail. Net::HTTP.new will fail without brackets on
joining the ipv6 address with :port or passing brackets to TCPSocket. It was
found that if we use Net::HTTP.start with url.hostname the incriminated code
won't be hit.

Change-Id: Ia70e05098b52121d12b035bdab59685b086523db
Closes-Bug: rhbz#1185652

commit_message:
Fix Keystone domain class

Currently ::heat::keystone::domain works only if keystonerc_admin
is sourced because of missing OS_TENANT_NAME env given to script
heat-keystone-setup-domain. This patch fixes this issue.

Change-Id: Idf5d35df2c39fe724350a00437b76be3333194c2

commit_message:
added option to configure flavor in heat.conf

Option to Specify Authentication method.
Set flavor to 'standalone' to get Heat to work with a remote OpenStack.
Defaults to 'keystone'

Change-Id: I5ff596b6418d71726714ec69211352dd5f4b8db2
Implements: blueprint option-to-configure-flavor-in-heat.conf

Use a SHA-256 checksum, rabbitmq_package_sha256, to verify that the
downloaded rabbitmq-server package is valid.

Change-Id: Ifa2e5609fd9a6853e20037e94a5e16696bb378ee
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2015-05-25 22:03:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Count all nested stack resources with DB operations

The count is performed with 2 queries:
- A recursive cte[1] query which builds a list of all nested stacks
- A query which counts resources which belong to the list
  of stacks

Considering this will be the basis for fixing bug #1455589 then this
approach wouldn't need further optimisation now, but the following
could be considered in the future:
- Make the cte query only return Stack.id, instead of entire stack
  objects
- Confirm the final count() call actually does a count query instead
  of loading all resources
- Build a single cte query which also counts resources (this might be
  possible, but very few developers would understand the resulting query)

[1] http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/rel_1_0/orm/query.html#sqlalchemy.orm.query.Query.cte

Partial-Bug: #1455589

Change-Id: Ifa2e5609fd9a6853e20037e94a5e16696bb378ee
", 'number': 2}, {'created': '2015-05-26 00:00:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Count all nested stack resources with DB operations

The count is performed in 2 parts
- A function which builds a list of all nested stacks
  by recursively calling stack_get_all_by_owner_id
- A query which counts resources which belong to the list

Considering this will be the basis for fixing bug #1455589 then this

calculated resource count.
